intro: Macaranga depressa f. depressa, commonly known as the broad-leafed macaranga, is a species of flowering plant in the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves with a rough texture. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are small and clustered, often greenish-yellow in color, and it produces capsules as its fruit. It is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests.
